g.text: 9+ Years of Experience in Motion Design
Orchestrated the end-to-end motion lifecycle for flagship promotional campaigns (e.g., Easter @ Sagebrush), from rigorous pre-
visualization and look development to final rendering, procedural versioning/transcoding, and format-localized asset delivery
Lead-engineered the church’s first exterior projection-mapping installation—wrapping the courtyard façade (360°) of
Sagebrush’s Riverside campus (NM) with seamless imagery driven by Unreal Engine 5, edge-blended via Pixera across a 6 × laser
stack, frame-accurately locked to FOH lighting & audio via SMPTE timecode.
Federated a self-hosted render farm of on-prem, network-linked GPU workstations, auto-scaling the fleet instances to slash 4K
OpenEXR frame render times by ~80% and turning multi-day queues into same-day photoreal sermon-bumper iterations.
Templatized lower-thirds, end-cards, etc. using After Effects Essential Graphics (.mogrt), allowing editors to alter and transform
them directly inside of Premiere, considerably reducing revision cycles.
Automated final-mile delivery with Python + FFmpeg, generating multi-aspect-ratio masters (16:9, 9:16, 1:1) and CALM-Act–
compliant audio (-24 LKFS), then batching uploads with VAST tags for instant trafficking.
Architected modular, data-driven motion-graphics packages for addressable OTT, OLV, OLA, and DCO campaigns, empowering
the ad server to auto-assemble 500 + localized permutations per flight. Ensured every version shipped with IAB VAST 4.2 XML,
ACIF-registered creative IDs, and CTV-safe bitrate/loudness specs.
Drove creative and technical growth by mentoring the team in sophisticated motion design principles, including procedural
animation with After Effects scripting & expressions and the implementation advanced compositing techniques, resulting in a
measurable improvement in output quality and team velocity.
Directed cross-functional strike teams of designers, editors, and VFX artists on enterprise-scale animated ad campaigns for
Fortune 100 clients, instituting real-time collaboration practices and agile rituals to keep story, design, and engineering in
Pioneered AI-augmented motion pipelines, integrating Adobe Firefly and other Sensei-powered tools to trim storyboard-to-
final-render cycles. These efficiency optimizations freed ~25-50% more bandwidth for creative polish, boosted repeat-client
bookings by 22%, and positioned the studio as an early mover in AI-for-design.
Owned end-to-end motion production for enterprise solution videos, translating VO scripts into interactive Figma storyboards,
crafting bespoke vector assets/kits, and compositing 3D assets, stock, and parametric cel animation into compelling, persuasive
